item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)

1.[Ḥaẓiyyān ʾAṣḥaḥ, the paterfamilias of the house of the lineage of Nasrum, and his wife] 2.[Shammarum and their children ʾAsadum and Dalwān and Ḥabbāsh and Thawrum, of the] 3.[lineage of ʿAqīratum have built and repaired their house of Dhū-Dahr Ḍarrān and added to it] 4.[a roof. And they excavated and plastered and constructed a cistern and a conduit(?). And they] constructed an irrigation scheme(?). And they] 5.[acquired their vineyard from the lineage of ʿArīm ʾAbīshirrān, and they planted their vineyard of Dhū-] 6.[Shabbāzān. And they acquired from the lineage of Kahnil a plot of land, the grazing capacity of which is] 7.[170 sheep. And they purchased male and female slaves. (All this) with the help of their] 8.[gods and by the command of their lords of the lineage of Sumhūsamaʿ.]

Ḥaẓiyyān ʾAṣḥaḥ, the paterfamilias of the house of the lineage of Nasrum, and his wife
Shammarum and their children ʾAsadum and Dalwān and Ḥabbāsh and Thawrum, of the
lineage of ʿAqīratum have built and repaired their house of Dhū-Dahr Ḍarrān and added to it
a roof. And they excavated and plastered and constructed a cistern and a conduit?. And they constructed an irrigation scheme?. And they
acquired their vineyard from the lineage of ʿArīm ʾAbīshirrān, and they planted their vineyard of Dhū-
Shabbāzān. And they acquired from the lineage of Kahnil a plot of land, the grazing capacity of which is
sheep. And they purchased male and female slaves. All this with the help of their
gods and by the command of their lords of the lineage of Sumhūsamaʿ.
